newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK PUBLIC POWER CORP TO LAUNCH 100.5BLN DRS LOAN.
newsitem.headline: GREEK PUBLIC POWER CORP TO LAUNCH 100.5BLN DRS LOAN.

text.p: Greece's Public Power Corporation will launch a 100.5 billion drachma, three-tranche syndicated loan, a source close to arrangers told Reuters.
Morgan Stanley International is the mandated arranger and has been joined by Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi and National Bank of Greece , the source said.

The first tranche is for a three-year, 25 billion drachma loan, the second tranche is for a five-year, 50.5 billion drachma loan and the third tranche is for a seven-year, 25 billion drachma loan, he said.
The loan will be based on three-month Athibor plus 17 basis points, the source said. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
